definition: to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: An asynchronous electrical signal from a peripheral to the processor.
sentences.chinese: 一个从外设到处理器的异步电信号。

sentences.english: They'll likely limit the number of peripherals supported, too.
sentences.chinese: 它们可能也会限制能够支持笔记本外设的数量。

sentences.english: When the peripheral asserts this signal, we say that an interrupt occurs.
sentences.chinese: 当外设发出这个信号，我们说一个中断发生。

sentences.english: The only time any peripherals go on is when I use them, too, like the printer.
sentences.chinese: 外设什么的用的时候再开，比如打印机。

sentences.english: The multimedia household computer is a high-tech product and a good hand AT home.
sentences.chinese: 家用电脑外设多媒体，高技术产品，家庭好助手。

sentences.english: The Genius mouse is abbreviated as the mouse, is one of the basic peripheral hardware of the microcomputer.
sentences.chinese: 鼠标器简称鼠标，是微型计算机的基本外设之一。

sentences.english: You can use your keyboard instead of a mouse, to move the mouse pointer.
sentences.chinese: 鼠标器简称鼠标，是微型计算机的基本外设之一。

definition: main engine/(military) lead aircraft/(computing) host computer/main processor/server
Micro-Star International (MSI), Taiwanese computer hardware company
